result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David James Schmidt

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David James Schmidt not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph P Bastien V in court for David James Schmidt.  Prosecuting attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
OFF THE RECORD:  Court is in trial and unable to hear this case.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant David James Schmidt not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph P Bastien V appeared by video for David James Schmidt.  Attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 41. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David James Schmidt not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph P Bastien V appeared by video for David James Schmidt.  Prosecuting attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defense's Bail Hearing held.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court denies defense's bail motion.  Defense counsel requests adjourned pretrial conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 41:
Defendant David James Schmidt in court with Attorney Joseph P Bastien; both appear by video.  Defendant David James Schmidt in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 41.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joseph P Bastien in court, defendant David James Schmidt not in court, in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for order to show cause. Defense counsel has been appointed and requests a preliminary hearing date. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing. Case adjourned to Branch PE. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David James Schmidt in court with attorney Thomas Holland Reed appearing as a friend of the Court.  Defendant David James Schmidt in custody.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for order to show cause hearing. Court hears arguments. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Order to show cause hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David James Schmidt not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
SPD Appointment of Counsel Report, filed
Received and Filed: Motion to Dismiss from Defendant.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 35
Defendant David James Schmidt not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR.35
Defendant David James Schmidt not in court, defendant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel.
 Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No Contact Order signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $100,000.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JSL (DOB 7/15/00) or CAS (DOB 1/7/1978)

Defendant David James Schmidt in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant David James Schmidt in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  David James Schmidt appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised if DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant Court orders the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4)  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
